ticket.title: [Patch] Fixes OrderedHash.[] constructs a broken hash
ticket.original-body: @@@ >> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4] => {1=>2, 3=>4} >> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys => [1, 3] >> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4] => #<OrderedHash {1=>2, 3=>4}> >> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys TypeError: can't dup NilClass from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `dup' from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `keys' from (irb):4 >> @@@
ticket.latest-body: @@@ >> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4] => {1=>2, 3=>4} >> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys => [1, 3] >> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4] => #<OrderedHash {1=>2, 3=>4}> >> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys TypeError: can't dup NilClass from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `dup' from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `keys' from (irb):4 >> @@@
ticket.original-body-html:
>> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4]
=> {1=>2, 3=>4}
>> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys
=> [1, 3]
>> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4]
=> #<OrderedHash {1=>2, 3=>4}>
>> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys
TypeError: can't dup NilClass
	from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `dup'
	from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `keys'
	from (irb):4
>>

version.body: @@@ >> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4] => {1=>2, 3=>4} >> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys => [1, 3] >> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4] => #<OrderedHash {1=>2, 3=>4}> >> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys TypeError: can't dup NilClass from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `dup' from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `keys' from (irb):4 >> @@@

>> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4]
=> {1=>2, 3=>4}
>> Hash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys
=> [1, 3]
>> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4]
=> #<OrderedHash {1=>2, 3=>4}>
>> ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1, 2, 3, 4].keys
TypeError: can't dup NilClass
	from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `dup'
	from /usr/local/ruby-1.8.6-p287/lib/ruby/gems/1.8/gems/activesupport-2.3.1/lib/active_support/ordered_hash.rb:49:in `keys'
	from (irb):4
>>
version.title: OrderedHash.[] constructs a broken hash

version.body:
ActiveRecord::OrderedHash.[] method was not available, so ordered keys were never set.
Fixing patch attached.
version.body-html:
ActiveRecord::OrderedHash.[] method was not available, so ordered keys were never set.

Fixing patch attached.
version.title: [Patch] Fixes OrderedHash.[] constructs a broken hash

version.body: Small nitpick: your test_alternate_initialization test doesn't test anything (i think you've just dropped the assert)
version.body-html: Small nitpick: your test_alternate_initialization test doesn't test anything (i think you've just dropped the assert)
version.title: [Patch] Fixes OrderedHash.[] constructs a broken hash

version.body:
(from [2bcb2443a9e2140e29799229d6c63a046e149597]) ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1,2,3,4] creates an OrderedHash instead of a Hash.
[#2615 state:committed]
Signed-off-by: Jeremy Kemper <jeremy@bitsweat.net> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/2bcb2443a9e2140e29799229d6c63a046e149597
version.body-html:
(from [2bcb2443a9e2140e29799229d6c63a046e149597]) ActiveSupport::OrderedHash[1,2,3,4] creates an OrderedHash instead of a Hash.

[#2615 state:committed]

Signed-off-by: Jeremy Kemper jeremy@bitsweat.net http://github.com/rails/rails/co...
